opened_prs.title: Better LRU and Fix for Deadlock
opened_prs.body:
I discovered a deadlock in the rollup boost server. I've posted a fix here using a concurrent, lock free LRU cache. In general this should make the code here more readable and less prone to errors.

As a general note, I've noticed that the way mutex locks are being handled in this code base seems to be pretty fast and loose. There were several cases where locks were being held far longer than they need to be.

repo.name: rollup-boost
repo.description: FORK: Sidecar to Enable Rollup Extensions

opened_prs.title: Add chaos testing
opened_prs.body:
This is still a draft since the setup is not that good yet.

The idea is that we can use a setup to deploy an Op-stack network (with Rollup-boost) and then create a unit test to deploy a reth builder with a proxy in front using the same utilities we use for integration tests.

Once that is done, we can randomly add delays and drop connections from the proxy to simulate chaos. Our success criteria is that even in this scenario, the liveness of the chain is not affected (there is a block every n seconds).

To deploy this setup you have to:

Run [this branch](https://github.com/ferranbt/optimism/tree/fb-v1.10.0) for the legacy op-stack docker-compose setup:
```
$ make devnet-up
```

Run `rollup-boost`:
```
$ cargo run -- --l2-url http://localhost:8551 --builder-url http://localhost:4444 --l2-jwt-token 688f5d737bad920bdfb2fc2f488d6b6209eebda1dae949a8de91398d932c517a --builder-jwt-token 688f5d737bad920bdfb2fc2f488d6b6209eebda1dae949a8de91398d932c517a
```

Run the unit test:
```
$ cargo test --features integration -- integration::integration_test::tests::test_integration_chaos --show-output --nocapture
```

Note that in the current unit test the genesis path is hardcoded to my computer. You would have to change that to test this.

My current thoughts:
- We should not use the docker-compose setup since it is a legacy system though I am not a fan of Kurtosis.
- The setup gets (way) more complicated if we have first to create a local Rollup-boost docker image and then run Kurtosis.

opened_prs.title: Add support for multiple builder and block selection

closed_prs.title: Metrics for engine client and proxy
closed_prs.body:
- Refactor of the EngineClient to record metrics from a specific source
- Adds metrics for json rpc responses for all calls (do we need this? may add overhead for deserialising the json rpc response)
- resolves https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/101 https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/100

closed_prs.title: Remove repeated metrics for RPC endpoint counters
closed_prs.body: Closes #100. We can use the new latency histogram metrics to return the counter as well.

closed_prs.title: Add kurtosis ci check
closed_prs.body:
This PR adds a CI check that validates that Rollup-boost works in Kurtosis.

- [x] Run Kurtosis
- [x] Send transactions that get sealed
- [x] Check whether the block builder built the block

Closes #113

closed_prs.title: Add production docs
closed_prs.body:
Resolves https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/86 https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/88 https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/89

https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/90 not yet in this PR, future work as follow up

Also adds a small change to the debug api to convert the enum to snake case

closed_prs.title: Add circuit breaker
closed_prs.body:
Resolves https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/issues/91

Notes:
- Only stops all engine calls to the builder (not forwarded calls - can add as a follow up if needed)
- Default to 5 slots 
- Updated README
- Adds test for circuit breaker condition

closed_issues.title: Add a nightly CI job to test Kurtosis with Rollup-boost
Record the backend with the latency of remote calls
closed_issues.body:
Right now the latency metrics are over how long it takes rollup boost to process each operation. It would be more interesting to know how long each backend takes to process each engine API operation.

We can see how long rollup boost takes via metrics on op-node.

closed_issues.title: Make FCU vs forkChoiceUpdated consistent in metrics
closed_issues.body: The count uses FCU, the latency uses fork_choice_updated

closed_issues.title: Circuit Breaker
closed_issues.body: Similar to the idea of a circuit breaker for mev-boost on L1, rollup boost should auto shut off a block builder if multiple invalid payloads come from that block builder. TBD what turning the builder back on looks like. https://hackmd.io/@ralexstokes/BJn9N6Thc

closed_issues.title: Document Invalid or Bad Payload Response from Block Builder
closed_issues.body:
There are two scenarios:
- What happens if the block builder gives an invalid block to rollup boost and the seqeuencer
- What happens if the block builder responds with a status 200 message such as "syncing"

closed_issues.title: Document Rollup Boost Release Testing Process
closed_issues.body: Document our process for being confident each rollup boost release does not contain any bugs, issues, memory leaks, etc. The goal should not be to develop and design an impenetrable line of defense, but to take the immediately high value efforts and document them.

closed_issues.title: Document how debug API + dry run mode work
closed_issues.body: Dry run builder mode and debug RPC were introduced in https://github.com/flashbots/rollup-boost/commit/22b0846866a5b5758b86c95f9da58f74e6cfe082 and we need documentation for how to use this mode and API.

closed_issues.title: More metrics
closed_issues.body:
Having latency metrics for:
- rpc calls to local execution node (with rpc method as attribute) in proxy.rs
- engine api metrics
     - separate them to builder vs local call
     - in particular forkchoiceupdatedv3 by whether it has_attribute, and no_tx_pool is set
- multiplexed rpc metrics, separated by local vs builder call 
- Metrics on HTTP / JSON RPC response codes

wartime_milady_ceo_summary: - **Summary of the Week's Activity:** This week, the repository focused primarily on enhancing the robustness and maintainability of the system through metrics improvements, CI checks, and documentation updates. The tone was proactive, with a mix of addressing technical debt and laying groundwork for future enhancements.

- **PR #119 - Metrics for Engine Client and Proxy:** This PR introduced a significant refactor of the EngineClient to incorporate metrics recording from a specific source. It added metrics for JSON RPC responses for all calls, resolving issues #101 and #100. This enhancement aims to provide better visibility into the system's performance, although it raises concerns about potential overhead from deserializing JSON RPC responses.
- **PR #114 - Add Kurtosis CI Check:** A new
